stars.description: I obtained my MAVO diploma at Lentiz Dalton Mavo, graduating cum laude with an additional course in History.

I was accepted into Grafisch Lyceum Rotterdam for the Software Development study. I chose this school because it also offered a minor in Game Development, which originally sparked my interest in studying there.
While attending the Grafisch Lyceum, I completed an official Unity exam through the school and earned a Unity certificate.

In my second year, I secured an internship at Badbit. Badbit is a company that maintains websites for other businesses and develops custom tools for clients. Such as a custom tool for Kiwa to help streamline their work processes.
I started my internship in my third year at the Grafisch Lyceum. Here I helped develop custom tools for clients, managed emails, and assisted in maintaining websites.

After completing my internship at Badbit, I was offered the opportunity to work there for a few additional months. I signed an official contract to continue working and support the company during this period.
After three years at the Grafisch Lyceum, I obtained my MBO diploma in Software Development.
I was accepted into HKU for the Creative Media and Game Technologies study. I became interested in this study because it focuses exclusively on game development and design.
After my first year at HKU, I obtained my propaedeutic diploma in Creative Media and Game Technologies.

I started working in the kitchen as a kitchen helper at De Keizer Restorbar, a mid-tier restaurant that serves lunch and dinner. Here, I help prepare appetizers and desserts, and occasionally assist with the main courses.
